net.joeclark.proceduralgeneration

Class RandomDrawGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.joeclark.proceduralgeneration.RandomDrawGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RandomTextGenerator

    public class RandomDrawGenerator
extends Object
implements RandomTextGenerator
    Draws text strings at random from a training dataset (but lowercase regardless of training data's case)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomDrawGenerator

        public RandomDrawGenerator()
        Initialize a new RandomDrawGenerator. A new instance begins with the default values for minLength, maxLength, startFilter, and endFilter. After initialization, you must train the model on a stream of input Strings before generating names, optionally first setting parameters such as minLength and maxLength, e.g.: new RandomDrawGenerator.withMinLength(4).withMaxLength(12),train(streamOfStrings)

        public RandomDrawGenerator withStartFilter(String startFilter)

      • train

        public RandomDrawGenerator train(Stream<String> rawWords)
        Ingest a new set of training data, overwriting any data that was previously trained. Subsequent random draws will be made from this data.

      • isTrained

        public boolean isTrained()
        Returns:
        true if the model was trained or re-trained. Don't attempt to generate names from an untrained model, or you'll get an InvalidStateException!

      • generateOne

        public String generateOne()
        Description copied from interface: RandomTextGenerator
        Generate a random text string, using the implementation's default configuration.
        Specified by:
        generateOne in interface RandomTextGenerator
        Returns:
        a random string from the training dataset (but lowercase). If you have set filters such as maximum and minimum length, or a starting and ending sequence, be careful that those filters are not impossible given the training data. You could end up with an infinite loop or an exception if your conditions are impossible to satisfy.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if model has not been trained
